title: Drawing, "The Upper End of Little Cottonwood Canyon, Wasatch Range, near Ogden, Utah", August 13, 1879
medium: Brush and watercolor, white goauche, graphite on gray laid paper
markings:
Watermark: PL BAS
Recto: Stamped in red ink, lower right: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union [Lugt 457d]
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink,  upper left corner:  7 ; in graphite, upper left:  the upper end of Little Cottonwood Canon Aug 13-79 ; in graphite, lower left:  (79) ; color and drawing notations in graphite throughout.
description: Panorama over a cliff edge toward three violet-crowned mountain peaks. Brown earth and rocks in the foreground; sky brushed in with white gouache.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Upper End of Little Cottonwood Canyon, Wasatch Range, near Ogden, Utah", August 13, 1879.
August 13, 1879. Brush and watercolor, white goauche, graphite on gray laid paper. Gift of Thomas Moran. 1917-17-79.
